title: 107_hr3622
content: The "Emergency Worker and Investor Protection Act of 2002" requires certain sales of company stock by corporate insiders to be subject to excise tax on golden parachute payments. The "Emergency Worker and Investor Protection Act of 2002" mandates that excess parachute payments include amounts from the sale of company stock by corporate insiders while the company maintains a transfer-restricted 401(k) plan. The term 'corporate insider' refers to an individual subject to section 16(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934. A 'transfer-restricted 401(k) plan' is a qualified cash or deferred arrangement where participants cannot freely sell employer stock held in their account. The subsection applies to sales and exchanges within 6 months of enactment. The amendment applies to sales and exchanges after the enactment date of the Act. SEC. 3. Denial of deduction for payments on debt instruments not included as liabilities for purposes of shareholder reporting. The amendment to section 163(l) of the Internal Revenue Code disallows deductions for certain debt instruments of corporations, specifically those payable in equity of the issuer or a related party. For SEC registrants, any undisclosed indebtedness or off-balance-sheet entity debt is also considered disqualified. The amendment to section 163(l) of the Internal Revenue Code disallows deductions for certain debt instruments of corporations if the proceeds are used to acquire stock. A certified annual report is defined as a report required to be filed with the SEC and certified by an independent public accountant. The term 'SEC registrant' refers to corporations required to file a certified annual report with the Securities and Exchange Commission, and any other entity whose assets and liabilities are consolidated with a reporting corporation. An 'off-balance-sheet entity' is an entity in which an SEC registrant holds an ownership interest, but its assets and liabilities are not consolidated with the registrant's for reporting purposes. The amendments made by this section apply to instruments issued after the date of the enactment of this Act.
